result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason Courtney Cameron Sr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay all costs, surcharges and supervision fees.
Cash bail on deposit to apply.  The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Court set restitution at zero.

Concurrent with: Concurrent with 15CF680; credit for 95 days served.
**8/3/2015  credit amended to 95 days.

superMiscConds.notes:
No contact with firearms.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon s/he must provide a DNA sample, his/her voting rights are suspended and s/he may never possess firearms.

No further violations of the law.
No contact during the entire sentence with victim unless approved by agent. Defendant may call the house to speak with his son.

Complete batterer's intervention program.
Attend parenting classes.
Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.

AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.

Per order of the Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Rebecca Dallet, Br. 40, for review. crt
Defendant's pro se request for sentence modification. Filed in 14CF680.

Defendant Jason Courtney Cameron in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz.  Defendant Jason Courtney Cameron in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  Court sentenced defendant to serve a Term of Imprisonment of 3 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prison, concurrent with 15CF680; credit for 148 days served.  Court ordered 1 YEAR Initial Term Of Confinement and 2 YEARS Extended Supervision.
Court found defendant not eligible for Challenge Incarceration or Earned Release Programs.

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- No further violations of the law.
- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- Attend parenting classes.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No contact during the entire sentence with victim unless approved by agent.  Defendant may call the house to speak with his son.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- Obtain GED/HSED.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay all costs, surcharges and supervision fees.  Cash bail on deposit to apply.  The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
- Court set restitution at zero.
 
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence. 
.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon s/he must provide a DNA sample, his/her voting rights are suspended and s/he may never possess firearms.

Defendant Jason Courtney Cameron in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz.  Defendant Jason Courtney Cameron in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
AS TO COUNT 2:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered charge dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.  
.
AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 40.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Jason Courtney Cameron in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz.  Defendant Jason Courtney Cameron in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Final Pretrial held.  Case remains set for jury trial on 4/20/15 in Branch 40.   On motion of the state, Court ordered 14CF573, 15CF680 and 15cf789 joined for the purpose of trial.  Court reminds defendant the no contact order remains in effect.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Jason Courtney Cameron in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz.  Defendant Jason Courtney Cameron in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.    
Defense counsel waived reading of the Information and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of defendant.  Court will address state's motion for joinder on the final pretrial date.  As there are new cases and counsel is not sure he will be ready for trial on those by 4/20/15, Court ordered a backup trial date set.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for April 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for May 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.
received and filed.  rmm
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Jason Courtney Cameron in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz.  Defendant Jason Courtney Cameron in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  City of Milwaukee Police Detective Mark Peterson.  Exhibit #1 received.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Exhibit withdrawn.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Arraignment scheduled for March 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Jason Courtney Cameron in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Jason Courtney Cameron in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Count 2.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 26, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
